page.title: 17NO HOOK REMEMBRANCE SERVICE
page.content: The Vicar of Hook,Rev.Brian Richards, has said he will not take a special Remembrance Sunday service with military march for local Royal British Legion members as he sees 'nothing worshipful about it'.However, he has stressed they will be very welcome at either of his remembrance services in church during the morning and they can of course parade as they wish. The Parish Council and Mr Bill Baggs,Hart Councillor,have shown approval for the march. Mr Dennis Gary,Legion branch secretary,has said he knows of over 50 members who would appreciate their own village service,especially as many do not have cars and are now elderly. Plans are now being made to gather at the War Memorial and to march to a service at either the Hook Junior School or Elizabeth Hall and to ask another vicar to take the service.
